form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Reid (for himself, Mr. Harkin, Mr. Durbin, Mrs. Murray, Ms. Mikulski, Mr. Leahy, Mr. Cardin, Mr. Lautenberg, Mr. Coons, Mrs. Gillibrand, Mr. Brown, Ms. Hirono, Mr. Schatz, Mr. Sanders, Mr. Menendez, Ms. Cantwell, and Mr. Levin) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To improve education and provide all students in the United States with the opportunity to succeed.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Strengthen our Schools and Students Act .
It is the sense of the Senate that Congress shouldâ€”

paragraph.text: strengthen early learning programs to better prepare children for success in school;

provide all teachers with the support they need to ensure student success, including the creation of a new national Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) Master Teacher Corps to recognize and help retain STEM teachers and strengthen STEM education in public schools in the United States; and
support States and local educational agencies to ensure schools have the safe and successful learning conditions in which all students can excel.
